OpenReadCompletedEventArgs Class

In this Article

Provides data for the OpenReadCompleted event.

Syntax

Declaration

public class OpenReadCompletedEventArgs : System.ComponentModel.AsyncCompletedEventArgs

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • EventArgs
  • System.ComponentModel.AsyncCompletedEventArgs
  • OpenReadCompletedEventArgs

Inherited Members

Cancelled
,

,
RaiseExceptionIfNecessary()
,

,

,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

Instances of this class are passed to OpenReadCompletedEventHandler methods.

Properties summary

Result

Gets a readable stream that contains data downloaded by a stem.Net.WebClient.DownloadDataAsync* method.

Properties

  • Result

    Gets a readable stream that contains data downloaded by a stem.Net.WebClient.DownloadDataAsync* method.

    public System.IO.Stream Result { get; }

    Property Value

    • Stream

      A Stream that contains the downloaded data.

    Remarks

    You should check the Error and Cancelled properties before using the data that is returned by this property. If the Error property's value is an Exception object or the Cancelled property's value is true, the asynchronous operation did not complete correctly and the Result property's value will not be valid.

    Example

    The following code example uses the stream returned by this property. 

    void OpenReadCallback2( Object^ /*sender*/, OpenReadCompletedEventArgs^ e )
{
   Stream^ reply = nullptr;
   StreamReader^ s = nullptr;
   try
   {
      reply = dynamic_cast<Stream^>(e->Result);
      s = gcnew StreamReader( reply );
      Console::WriteLine( s->ReadToEnd() );
   }
   finally
   {
      if ( s != nullptr )
      {
         s->Close();
      }
      if ( reply != nullptr )
      {
         reply->Close();
      }
   }

}


        private static void OpenReadCallback2 (Object sender, OpenReadCompletedEventArgs e)
    {
        Stream reply = null;
        StreamReader s = null;

        try
        {
            reply = (Stream)e.Result;
            s = new StreamReader (reply);
            Console.WriteLine (s.ReadToEnd ());
        }
        finally
        {
            if (s != null)
            {
                s.Close ();
            }

            if (reply != null)
            {
                reply.Close ();
            }
        }
    }

            Private Shared Sub OpenReadCallback2(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As OpenReadCompletedEventArgs)

            Dim reply As Stream = Nothing
            Dim s As StreamReader = Nothing

            Try

                reply = CType(e.Result, Stream)
                s = New StreamReader(reply)
                Console.WriteLine(s.ReadToEnd())
            Finally

                If Not s Is Nothing Then

                    s.Close()
                End If

                If Not reply Is Nothing Then

                    reply.Close()
                End If
            End Try
        End Sub
